meeting_annotations.speaker: Laurie Barge, NASA JPL
meeting_annotations.transcript: I think that is possible and also we have to remember that, you know, life today is really specific and has been going on a very long time and is very tied to its planet and the planet's evolution. I don't personally, I don't think the goal should be look for life elsewhere. I think it should be characterize organic chemical states of planets and understand what life is. Because without a definition of life, it's kind of impossible to do either origin of life or life detection. Like we've learned a lot in the past 20 years about what life is.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Laurie Barge, NASA JPL
meeting_annotations.transcript: So I don't think I don't think we're ready yet to say this is it, this is not it.
